description: Aqualung was the original name for the first open-circuit SCUBA diving equipment by Emile Gagnan and Jacques Cousteau in 1943. From aqua- +â€Ž lung.

entries.meaning: (underwater diving) A piece of equipment consisting of an oxygen tank and breathing apparatus used by divers to allow them to breathe underwater.

verbs.description: aqualung (third-person singular simple present aqualungs, present participle aqualunging, simple past and past participle aqualunged)
